titles.title: Personal Pictures Protection Act of 2005
To amend title 18, United States Code, to punish the placing of sexual explicit photographs on the Internet without the permission of the persons photographed.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, and Homeland Security.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 3/9/2005--Introduced. Personal Pictures Protection Act of 2005 - Amends the Federal criminal code to prohibit placing photographs of a person's sexually explicit conduct on a computer so that they are accessible on the Internet, with the intent to embarrass or cause such person emotional distress and without such person's permission.
